messages.Account.TOTP.Title: Dupaŝa Aŭtentigo
messages.Account.TOTP.Initializing: Kontrolanta staton de 2PA por via konto...
messages.Account.TOTP.Code.Description:
Unue vi devas entajpi sekretan kodon por via TOTP aŭtentiga apo, kiel Authy aŭ Google Authenticator.

Ni rekomendas fari tion per skano de la QR kodo, sed alternative vi povas permane entajpi la sekretan kodon. Neniam diskonigu ĉi tiun kodon kun iu ajn.

Se vi estas en VR, vi povas ŝanĝi al via komputilo premante F8.
messages.Account.TOTP.RecoveryCodes.Description: Konservu ĉi tiujn kodojn en sekura loko. Vi povas uzi ilin por restaŭri la enireblon al via konto okaze de perdo aŭ difekto de via poŝtelefono. Ĉiu kodo povas esti uzita nur unufoje. Neniam diskonigu ilin kun iu ajn. Se vi perdas ilin, vi perdos PORĈIAME la enireblon al via konto.
messages.Account.TOTP.Activate.Description:
Por aktivigi 2PA por via konto, uzu la 6-ciferan ĵetonon, kion generis vian aŭtentigilo por certigi ke ĉio funkcias ĝuste.

Kiam aktivigita, vi bezonos uzi la kodon dum konfirmi certajn agadojn.
messages.Account.TOTP.Message.AlreadySetup: 2FA estas jam agordita en via konto!
messages.Account.TOTP.Message.SetupComplete:
Gratulojn!

Via konto estas nuntempe agordita per 2PA por aldona protekto!

Vi povas opcie eligi ĉi tion por via kontoensaluto per la komando /enableLogin2FA .
messages.Account.TOTP.Deactivate.Description:
2PA estas nuntempe agordita kaj aktiva en via konto. Se vi bezonas malaktivigi ĝin (ekz. kaŭze ke vi perdas vian poŝtelefonon aŭ la kodoj endanĝeriĝas), vi povas fari tion tie ĉi.

Post malaktivigo, vi povas agordi 2FA denove, kio generos tute novan sekretan kodon kaj novan aron de restaŭran kodojn.

Se vi perdas vian poŝtelefonon kaj bezonas agordi 2FA denove, ni FORTE konsilas ke vi faru tuj, ĉar ĉiu restaŭra kodo uzeblas nur unufoje kaj post kiam ili elĉerpiĝos vi estos tute ŝlosita ekster via konto.
messages.Account.TOTP.Message.DeactivationComplet:
2FA sukcese malaktiviĝis en via konto.

Via konto estas nun en pli alta risko!

Ni forte rekomendas agordi tuj 2FA denove, speciale se vi uzis restaŭran kodon kaŭze de tio ke vi perdis vian poŝtelefonon.

messages.FullBody.HeightInstructions: Certigu, ke ĉi tio estas via reala alteco, alie la kalibrigo ne funkcios ĝuste. La manekeno devas kongrui kun la VR-surkasko kaj regiloj.
messages.FullBody.HeightWarning: Ĉi tio ŝajnas malĝusta. Certigu, ke ĝi estas via reala alteco.
messages.FullBody.MappingInstructions: Stariĝu vertikala pozicio kaj certigu, ke la spuroj spuras kaj detektas ĝuste.
messages.FullBody.JustCalibrateAvatarDescription: Preterpasu plenan korpan kalibrigon kaj simple kalibrigu la avataron
messages.FullBody.CalibrateInstructions: Vicigu vin per la ruĝ-korpa surmeto en via ludspaco kaj premu ambaŭ ellasilojn por konfirmi. Certigu, ke viaj veraj piedoj kaj koksoj kongruas kun la virtualaj kiel eble plej proksime.
messages.FullBody.BeforeCalibrationInstructions: Certigu, ke spuriloj spuras kaj ke via alteco estas agordita
messages.FullBody.CalibratingPoseInstructions: Vicigu vin kun la referenco kaj premu ambaŭ ellasilojn por konfirmi
messages.FullBody.AdjustAvatarInstructions: Agordi avatarajn korpajn kompensojn por plej bone kongrui kun la referenco
messages.FullBody.FineTuneCalibrationInstructions: Kontroli kaj agordi kalibrigon movante bluajn referencojn
messages.FullBody.CalibrateTrackersInstructions:
Ekprenu kaj poziciigu la bluajn korpopartojn rilate al la spuriloj por ĝustigi ilian deŝovon. Ili devas kongrui kun la loko de la spurilo sur via korpo. 
Vi povas alĝustigi la kalibrigon iam ajn remalfermante ĉi tiun ilon.
messages.FullBody.HeightCompensationInstructions: Se la manekeno estas tro alta (kurbiĝinta) aŭ tro mallonga, ĝustigu la altan kompenson por plej bona mezuro.
messages.FullBody.CalibrateAvatarInstructions: Certigu, ke ĉiuj korpopartoj estas mapitaj kaj tiam trenu la bluajn sferojn ĉirkaŭe, por ke la avataro plej kongruu kun la korporeferenco.
messages.FullBody.AvatarHeightCompensationInstruc: Se la avataro estas tro alta (finiĝas kurbiĝinta) aŭ tro mallonga por ke vi ĝustigu ĝian altokompenson ĉi tie por ke ĝi pli taŭgas al via alteco.
messages.FullBody.AvatarHeightCompensation: Kompenso de Avatara Alteco: {n, number, percent}
messages.FullBody.AvatarSaveWarning: Ne forgesu konservi vian avataron post kiam vi finos ĝin kalibrigi!
messages.FullBody.CalibrationFinishedInstructions: Se vi kontentas pri la kalibrigo, vi povas konservi vian avataron nun kaj eliri.
messages.FullBody.CalibrationRedoInstructions:
Se la kalibrigo estas malŝaltita aŭ vi volas kalibri pli da avataroj, vi povas fari pli da ĝustigoj. Vi ankaŭ povas remalfermi ĉi tiun kalibrigilon iam ajn estonte por fari agordojn. 
 Se vi nur ŝanĝis viajn spurilojn, vi ne bezonas kalibrigi viajn avatarojn denove.

messages.Settings.OnlineStatusSettings.DefaultSta: Ĉi tio estas la defaŭlta stato en kiu vi komencos antău ol ensalti, krom se ekzistas stato antaŭe memorita.
messages.Settings.OnlineStatusSettings.RememberMo: Uzi ĉi tiu kontrolilo se via lasta stato estu konservita inter ensaltoj aŭ ne. Ĉi tiu inkluzas iuj ajn statoj krom Nevidebla, kiu kontroliĝis per aparta agordo.
messages.Settings.OnlineStatusSettings.RememberTi: Via lasta stato memoriĝis nur se vi ensaltos denove en ĉi tiu tempokadro. Se vi atendos pli longe ol ĉi tiu, vi anstataŭ komencos en via defaŭlta stato.
messages.Settings.OnlineStatusSettings.InvisibleR:
Ĉi tiu kontrolos kiel via lasta stato estas memorita aparte se vi estas laste agordita al Nevidebla. Krome ĉi tiu funkcias same.

La nevidebla stato havas aparta agordo pro kialoj de priveco, por certigi ke se vi estis laste agordita al nevidebla, vi povas certigi ke vi restos nevidebla dum la sekvanta ensalto eĉ se viaj aliaj statoj ne estas memorotaj.
Via lasta nividebla stato memoriĝis nur se vi ensaltos denove en ĉi tiu tempokadro. Se vi atendos pli longe ol ĉi tiu, vi anstataŭ komencos en via defaŭlta stato.
messages.Settings.OnlineStatusSettings.AutoAwayTi: Ŝanĝi al Stato 'For' kiam senokupa dum
Kiam vi estas senokupa dum ĉi tiu kvanto da tempo, via ensalta stato aŭtomate ŝanĝos al 'For'.  Kiam vi revenos, ĝi aŭtomate ŝanĝos al antaŭa stato, krom se vi agordos ĝin al 'For' permane.
messages.Settings.GeneralControlsSettings.Primary: Which hand is considered your primary. Various systems use this for interactions, e.g. when equipping tools.
messages.Settings.GeneralControlsSettings.DoubleC: This controls the maximum amount of time that may pass between the first and second clicks of a double-click. If you are triggering double clicks too frequently, decrease this value. If you are having trouble triggering double clicks, raise this value.
messages.Settings.MovementSettings.LeftSidewaysMo: Use this to determine what the sideways joystick/touchpad motion on your left controller will do.
messages.Settings.MovementSettings.RightSidewaysM: Use this to determine what the sideways joystick/touchpad motion on your right controller will do.
messages.Settings.MovementSettings.UseHeadDirecti: When enabled, moving forward will move you in whatever direction you are currently looking for while in VR. When disabled, the direction your controller is pointing will be used instead.
This will gradually rotate you when turning while in VR. This can be more immersive, but is more likely to induce nausea. Turn this setting off if you prefer snap turning.
messages.Settings.MovementSettings.SmoothTurnExcl: When enabled, a single joystick can either move you forward/backward or turn you, but never both at the same time. Enable this if you're often accidentally turning while just trying to move.
messages.Settings.MovementSettings.SmoothTurnSpee: This setting controls how fast you will turn when smooth turning is enabled. The value is degrees per second, so a value of 360 will turn you full circle in one second at full joystick tilt.
This is the angle (in degrees) you will rotate when you trigger a snap turn.
messages.Settings.MovementSettings.NoClipSpeed.De: This controls how fast you'll move when you're using the Noclip locomotion specifically. This type of locomotion is often used for building and testing and as such is not controlled by the world you're in, while others typically are.
messages.Settings.MovementSettings.MovementDeadzo: This setting can be used to correct drift. Increasing this value will require you to tilt your joystick further to start moving.
messages.Settings.MovementSettings.TurningDeadzon: This setting can be used to correct drift and prevent accidental turning when moving and turning on the same joystick. Increasing this value will require you to tilt your joystick further to start turning.
messages.Settings.MovementSettings.MovementExpone: Use this to control the curve response when moving. You can use this to either start moving slow at first and then quickly ramp up or start moving faster immediately, depending whether the value is above or below 1.0
messages.Settings.GrabbingSettings.DefaultHandGra:
This determines what your default grab mode for hands is when you spawn in new worlds.

<color=hero.yellow>Palm:</color> You will grab all objects that are near your palm.

<color=hero.yellow>Precision:</color> You will grab a single object between your index finger and thumb.

<color=hero.yellow>Auto:</color> Mode is automatically switched between palm and precision depending on the orientation of your hand.

<color=hero.yellow>Off:</color> You'll only be able to grab items with your lasers.
messages.Settings.FullBodyTrackingSettings.BodyHo: This is the angle deviation between feet and head, beyond which you'll be considered in a horizontal pose. This affects certain things like overriding your tracker poses with feet simulation.
messages.Settings.GamepadSettings.ThumbstickLookS: Use this to adjust the sensitivity of the speed at which the viewpoint is moved with the thumbstick.
messages.Settings.GamepadSettings.ThumbstickLookE: Use this to control the curve response of the viewpoint movement with the thumbstick. With this setting, you can either start moving slowly at first and then ramp up quickly, or start moving faster immediately, depending on whether the value is above or below 1.0.
messages.Settings.GamepadSettings.UseGamepadWhenU: When this setting is enabled, any inputs from gamepads will be used even when the application window isn't currently focused. You can turn this off if you like to run other games at the same time that also use gamepad.
Overall mouse sensitivity for desktop interactions.
messages.Settings.MouseSettings.MouseLookSpeed.De: Use this to adjust the sensitivity of how fast the camera looks around when in first or third person mode.
messages.Settings.MouseSettings.MousePanSpeed.Des: This controls how fast the view looks with mouse movement when in UI aligned viewing mode.
When holding items in desktop mode, this controls how fast they will be rotated around their axis with the mouse.
messages.Settings.MouseSettings.MouseFreeformRota: When holding items in desktop mode, this controls how fast they will be rotated when using freeform rotation.
messages.Settings.MouseSettings.ScrollWheelGrabMo: When holding items in desktop mode, this controls how fast they will move back and forth with the scroll wheel on your mouse.
messages.Settings.KeyboardLookSettings.LookEnable:
When enabled, Keyboard Look allows you to move your head around using the arrow keys on your keyboard.
It is designed for scenarios when a mouse might not be available or suitable, such as when using a laptop or when accessible alternatives to a mouse are required.
messages.Settings.KeyboardLookSettings.Horizontal: Use this to adjust how fast your head moves horizontally when using Keyboard Look.
messages.Settings.KeyboardLookSettings.VerticalSp: Use this to adjust how fast your head moves vertically when using Keyboard Look.
messages.Settings.GeneralHapticsSettings.EnableCo: Use this to enable or disable haptic vibration specifically on VR controllers.
messages.Settings.GeneralHapticsSettings.EnableHa: When enabled, you will receive haptic feedback from avatars and items in the world on your controllers and other haptic devices.
messages.Settings.GeneralVRSettings.UseVRHotswitc: When enabled, you will automatically be switched between VR and desktop mode when you take your VR headset on or off
messages.Settings.TrackingSmoothingSettings.HandP: When enabled, this controls how much the hand position is smoothed out. Typically this is helpful for users with tremors and other accessibility issues that cause jitter.
messages.Settings.TrackingSmoothingSettings.HandR: When enabled, this controls how much the hand rotation is smoothed out. Typically this is helpful for users with tremors and other accessibility issues that cause jitter.
messages.Settings.TrackingSmoothingSettings.FeetP: When enabled, this controls how much the position of feet is smoothed out when using full body tracking. This can be useful to eliminate vibrations and jitter, but it also makes the trackers lag behind more and not respond to rapid motions as well.
messages.Settings.TrackingSmoothingSettings.FeetR: When enabled, this controls how much the rotation of feet is smoothed out when using full body tracking. This can be useful to eliminate vibrations and jitter, but it also makes the trackers lag behind more and not respond to rapid motions as well.
messages.Settings.TrackingSmoothingSettings.HipsP: When enabled, this controls how much the position of hips is smoothed out when using full body tracking. This can be useful to eliminate vibrations and jitter, but it also makes the trackers lag behind more and not respond to rapid motions as well.
messages.Settings.TrackingSmoothingSettings.HipsR: When enabled, this controls how much the rotation of hips is smoothed out when using full body tracking. This can be useful to eliminate vibrations and jitter, but it also makes the trackers lag behind more and not respond to rapid motions as well.
messages.Settings.MediaPrivacySettings.MediaMetad:
When enabled, you will be excluded from metadata in captured media (typically virtual photos & audio clips). You will still appear in those media assets, but no information, such as your UserID and position in the scene will be stored alongside it.

If you become aware of any users are modifying their clients to ignore this opt out, please report them to the moderation team, as this would be considered harassment.
messages.Settings.MediaPrivacySettings.HideInScre: Do not show me in screenshots

When enabled, you will not be rendered in screenshots captured in-game.

<color=hero.red>IMPORTANT:</color> Please note that this does not affect realtime cameras, screenshots taken by methods outside of the game or captures done through other methods in-world that might be part of the world's mechanics.
messages.Settings.MediaPrivacySettings.StripImage: When enabled, strips metadata from images on import. Includes EXIF, Embedded comments, IPTC, XMP, and GEOTIFF metadata. This will also strip any location data (such as GPS) within that metadata. Does not, include files imported with the "Raw File" option.
messages.Settings.DiscordIntegrationSettings.Rich:
Controls what information {appName} sends to Discord's Rich Presence systems.

<color=hero.yellow>None</color> - Do not send Rich Presence information to Discord.
<color=hero.yellow>Basic</color> - Send only limited details such as your presence in {appName}.
<color=hero.yellow>Full</color> - When in a public session, send all suitable session information to Discord. Includes the world name and how many users are in the session.

Discord itself also does its own detection to display what game you are playing. This can be disabled in Discord's settings.
messages.Settings.SteamIntegrationSettings.RichPr:
Controls what information {appName} sends to Steam's Rich Presence systems.

<color=hero.yellow>None</color> - Do not send Rich Presence information to Steam.
<color=hero.yellow>Basic</color> - Send only limited details such as your presence in {appName}.
<color=hero.yellow>Full</color> - When in a public session, send all suitable session information to Steam. Includes the world name and how many users are in the session.

Steam itself will display that you are playing {appName} regardless of this setting. Changing this setting only affects how much extra data is sent to Steam about your active session.
messages.Settings.SteamIntegrationSettings.SaveSc: When you take a picture with this setting enabled, a copy will be saved to Steam screenshots.
messages.Settings.SteamIntegrationSettings.ForceS: Force Steam Voice when Remote Play is active

When enabled, this automatically forces the audio input to use Steam Voice when you play through Steam Remote Play. This helps so you don't need to switch automatically to use the forwarded microphone input.

Disabling this can be useful if you want to use your own audio device - e.g. external microphone.
messages.Settings.LeapMotionSettings.LeapMotionEn: When enabled, the Leap Motion device will be used to track your hands and fingers when present.
messages.Settings.LeapMotionSettings.Offset.Descr: This is the offset in meters of the Leap Motion sensor on your VR headset. Tweak these values to make sure your hands are positioned correctly.
messages.Settings.LeapMotionSettings.SnapDistance: When your hands are within the range of controllers, they will automatically snap to them and use the hand tracking data from the controller itself, instead of Leap Motion. This controls the distance at which the hands will snap.
messages.Settings.LeapMotionSettings.UseFingersWh: When hands are snapped to controllers, this will still pose the fingers using data coming from the Leap Motion
messages.Settings.ViveHandTrackingSettings.ViveHa: When enabled, your hands and fingers will be tracked using the Vive hand tracking. This typically uses the cameras on the VR headset itself. You might need to enable the hand tracking in Steam VR settings.
messages.Settings.ViveHandTrackingSettings.SnapDi: When your hands are within the range of controllers, they will automatically snap to them and use the hand tracking data from the controller itself, instead of the headset cameras. This controls the distance at which the hands will snap.
messages.Settings.ViveHandTrackingSettings.UseFin: When hands are snapped to controllers, this will still pose the fingers using data coming from the VR headset cameras
messages.Settings.TrackerSettings.UseTrackers.Des: Using this option you can globally disable all body trackers. This can be useful if your trackers are in a corner and charging, resulting in your avatar being crumpled up.
messages.Settings.TrackerSettings.Trackers.UseTra: Should this tracker be used for tracking? You can use this to temporarily disable given tracker without having to reset its mapping.
messages.Settings.TrackerSettings.Trackers.Freeze: Enabling this will keep the tracker active, but freeze its current position and rotation. This setting is not persistent and will be reset on the next launch.
messages.Settings.TrackerSettings.Trackers.Custom: You can give the tracker a custom name to make it easy to distinguish from others, rather than using its ID. This is mostly cosmetic, with no functional differences.
messages.Settings.TrackerSettings.Trackers.Mapped:
Which body part is this tracker mapped to for full body tracking.

We recommend using the full body calibration to set this setting, instead of adjusting it manually here.

The position of the tracker relative to the body part that it's mapped to.

We recommend using the full body calibration to set this setting, instead of adjusting it manually here.

The rotation of the tracker relative to the body part that it's mapped to.

We recommend using the full body calibration to set this setting, instead of adjusting it manually here.
messages.Settings.TrackerSettings.Trackers.UseInV: Should this tracker affect your avatar while in VR mode?
messages.Settings.TrackerSettings.Trackers.UseInD: Should this tracker affect your avatar while in desktop mode?
messages.Settings.TrackerSettings.Trackers.Tracke: Unique ID of this tracker. This information is considered private and is not the same ID as one that will be shown in world to avoid tracking through fingerprinting.
The current battery level of this tracker. Note that some trackers might not support tracking current battery level.
This indicates if the tracker is currently charging. Note that some trackers might not support reporting this information.
Which port should be used for listening for OSC face tracking data. This should match the same port you set in SteamVR settings for the face tracking to work.
messages.Settings.HapticPointMapping.MappingTarge: Use this to configure which part of the avatar you want this device to be mapped to.
This lets you control the size of the haptic point on the avatar. Making it bigger will make it easier to trigger from bigger distances, but also results in less precision, as any haptic trigger within the point's volume will activate it.
messages.Settings.HapticPointMapping.TorsoHorizon: This is the horizontal position along torso, going from left to the right
messages.Settings.HapticPointMapping.TorsoVertica: This is the vertical position along torso, going from the bottom to the top.
messages.Settings.HapticPointMapping.TorsoSide.De: This indicates which side of torso should this device be mapped to (front or back)
messages.Settings.HapticPointMapping.HeadPitchAng: This controls position along the "vertical" axis of the head. The default position is the center of face (where your nose is). Increasing the angle will go upwards toward the top of your head. Decreasing the value goes downwards towards the chin.
messages.Settings.HapticPointMapping.HeadYawAngle: This controls the horizontal position around head, turning left or right. The center (where your nose is) is the default pose. Decreasing the value will go left, increasing will go right. This wraps all around the head in a circle at 180°, which is where the back of your head is.
messages.Settings.HapticPointMapping.ArmSide.Desc: Which arm should this map to? Left or right?
messages.Settings.HapticPointMapping.ArmPositionA: This controls the position along the arm. This starts at the shoulder and goes all the way to the wrist. Midway position is where the elbow is.
messages.Settings.HapticPointMapping.ArmAngleArou: This controls the angle around the circumference of the arm. The default 0° position is aligned with the top of your hand. Going negative will go left, positive to the right. Wrapping around 180° will put the point at the side of your arm where your palm is.
messages.Settings.HapticPointMapping.LegSide.Desc: Which leg should this map to? Left or right?
messages.Settings.HapticPointMapping.LegPositionA: This controls the position along the leg. This starts at the hips and goes all the way to the ankle. Midway position is where the knee is.
messages.Settings.HapticPointMapping.LegAngleArou: This controls the angle around the circumference of the leg. The default 0° position is aligned with the front of your leg - the direction your knee is pointing. Going negative will go left, positive to the right. Wrapping around 180° will put the point at the back side of your leg.
messages.Settings.HapticPointMapping.ControllerSi: Which controller should this haptic point be mapped to? Left or right?
messages.Settings.HapticPointMapping.Tag.Descript:
Tag associated with this haptic point. This will map to the point on your avatar with a matching haptic tag specified on the TagHapticPointMapper component. If no point with this haptic tag is defined on the avatar, the haptic device will not work.

This is useful when you need full control over precise point on the avatar that the haptic device will be mapped to - e.g. when the generalized mapping doesn't suit your needs.
messages.Settings.GiggleTechSettings.GigglePuckIP:
If your GigglePuck isn't automatically detected on the network, fill its IP address in this field and then click the button below to add it manually.

Once added, go to "Manage GigglePucks" to configure it.
messages.Settings.GiggleTechSettings.Devices.UseD: You can use this to enable or disable individual GigglePucks when they are mapped. Disabling the device will stop all the haptics.
messages.Settings.GiggleTechSettings.Devices.Alwa:
When this is enabled, the GigglePuck will be always considered to be connected, even if it's not detected on the network.

This can be useful for certain networks that might have issues with automatic detection.
messages.Settings.GiggleTechSettings.Devices.Inte: This lets you scale the intensity of the haptics sent to the GigglePuck. The actual strength of the haptics will never go beyond GigglePuck's maximum safe value - the values are clamped to safe maximum that will not overvolt the motor.
messages.Settings.GiggleTechSettings.Devices.Cust: You can use this to give this GigglePuck a custom name for easier reference. This is purely cosmetic and has no functional differences.
messages.Settings.GiggleTechSettings.Devices.Mini: This is the minimum intensity that the haptic will be run at. When the intensity is too low, this can cause the haptic device to stall and stop responding.
messages.Settings.GiggleTechSettings.Devices.Init: When the haptics go from inactive to active, they will be run at at least this amount of intensity for a very short time period. This can help "kick-start" the haptics, when the activation value is too low for the motor to start spinning.
This is your real world height, which is used to properly scale your avatar so it fits you well. It is also the height you will be placed at when you enable seated mode.

You can enter your height by using appropriate units, for example by typing <nobr><color=hero.yellow>175 cm</color></nobr> or <nobr><color=hero.yellow>1.75 m</color></nobr> for metric or <color=hero.yellow>5'11"</color> for imperial.
messages.Settings.FavoritesSettings.AutoLoadCloud: When enabled, your cloud home will be automatically loaded on startup. If you'd prefer it to not be loaded, you can disable this option. It will take effect next time you start.
messages.Settings.AudioInputDeviceSettings.UseSys: Enable this to automatically use the input device you have set as default input in your system. If you'd like to override this and use a specific device instead, disable this option and configure the preferred devices below.
messages.Settings.AudioInputDeviceSettings.Testin: You can use this to monitor and test the selected audio device to ensure it's working properly. Use the button to listen to the input, which will play the sound back at you.
messages.Settings.AudioOutputDeviceSettings.UseSy: Enable this to use the default system device for outputting audio. By disabling this, you can configure which audio device is used for outputting the audio below. This can be useful when you use different devices when toggling between VR and desktop.
messages.Settings.AudioVolumeSettings.MasterVolum: This controls the volume of everything uniformly. If everything is too loud or quiet, you can tweak this setting.
messages.Settings.AudioVolumeSettings.SoundEffect: Adjust the volume of all sound effects. These are typically sounds that various items and gadgets make.
messages.Settings.AudioVolumeSettings.MultimediaV: Control the audio volume of various multimedia. Typically audio, music and video players are classified as multimedia as well as background sound tracks in the world.
messages.Settings.AudioVolumeSettings.VoiceVolume: This controls the speech volume of all other users. In some cases pre-recorded voice clips will also be controlled by this setting. You can also adjust volume of individual users in the Session tab.
messages.Settings.AudioVolumeSettings.UserInterfa: With this setting, you can adjust the sound effects of UI specifically - hovering and pressing buttons, sliders, some tools interactions, capturing photos and so on.
messages.Settings.AudioAccessibilitySettings.Whis: When you have Whisper mode activated, this indicates how loud sounds outside of the sphere will be. If they are too loud or too quiet, you can use this to tweak the volume attenuation.
messages.Settings.AudioAccessibilitySettings.Voic: This indicates how loud other sounds will be when you are recording a voice message in Contacts. This can help prevent "voice jamming", making it easier to focus on what you are saying.
messages.Settings.AudioInputFilteringSettings.Use: This feature will try to ensure that your voice input is brought to a uniform level. This helps make your volume the same as other users, regardless of your microphone settings. We strongly recommend to keep this setting on to ensure you can be heard well by other users.
messages.Settings.AudioInputFilteringSettings.Noi: Noise gate prevents background noises from being transmitted to other users. This setting indicates the maximum volume at which sounds will be filtered out. If too much noise is making it in, increase this setting, if your voice is not getting through, lower it.

This indicates how fast the noise gate responds to an incoming sound that is louder than the threshold volume. Larger values will result in a slower volume fade in, while smaller ones will make the volume ramp up quicker.
This controls how long it takes for the noise gate to begin to close after the microphone input volume falls below the threshold volume.
This setting controls how fast the noise gate closes after the incoming audio has quieted again.
messages.Settings.AudioInputFilteringSettings.Nor: Using this setting you can control the threshold when the incoming audio will become amplified. If your normal speech is too quiet and it's not getting amplified, lower this setting. If random quiet noises are being amplified, increase it.
messages.Settings.AudioInputFilteringSettings.Use: This feature processes the incoming audio to filter out various undesirable noises. This can clean up audio from noisy microphones considerably, producing a cleaner voice. We strongly recommend keeping this setting on. However, it can also filter out certain noises that do not get identified as speech.
messages.Settings.VoiceSettings.MutePersistence.D:
<color=hero.yellow>Start Unmuted:</color> When you log in, you will always start unmuted.

<color=hero.yellow>Started Muted:</color> When you log in, your voice will always start muted. You will either have to unmute or press the "push to talk" key (V by default) to speak.

<color=hero.yellow>Remember Last: </color> When you login, the status from the last time you logged out will be preserved.
When earmuff mode is activated, voices of users will be significantly attenuated based on their distance and the direction you are facing.

In effect, this creates a "listening cone", which can help when there are too many overlapping voices in a world.
This controls how directional the voice attenuation is. At 0 %, voices behind you will be at same volume as voices same distance in front of you. At 100 % values, you will not hear voices behind you unless they're really close.

If you want to hear voices behind you better, lower this value.
messages.Settings.EarmuffSettings.Distance.Descri: This controls the distance in front of you (and behind you if directionality is 0 %) beyond which will voices become quieter.
messages.Settings.EarmuffSettings.Angle.Descripti: This controls the angle in front of your face within which the voices are at their normal level. Any voices beyond this angle will start attenuating once they reach the transition distance.
messages.Settings.EarmuffSettings.TransitionStart: This controls the distance from the "listening cone" at which voices will become quieter. It's recommended to keep this above zero, because that will better include voices on the sides and voices near your head (e.g. users who are technically behind you, but very close).
messages.Settings.EarmuffSettings.TransitionLengt: Use this to control the distance over which the voices will fade from their normal volume to fully attenuated. Larger values will transition the volume more smoothly, while lower values will result in more abrupt transition.
messages.Settings.EarmuffSettings.VolumeAttenuati: This controls how loud voices beyond the "listening cone" will be. Setting this to 0 % will completely mute all users beyond the listening cone.
messages.Settings.RealtimeNetworkingSettings.Disa: This disables networking features specific to local networks, such as broadcasting your session on the local network or listening to other sessions broadcasted on this network.
messages.Settings.RealtimeNetworkingSettings.Pref: When enabled, you will connect via Steam Networking Sockets protocol if possible. This can help in some cases when LNL protocol results in significant queuing. However as this protocol is missing some features, you can run into more networking instability, so we recommend only enabling this once you ran into issues.

When enabled, connections over TCP are preferred over all other protocols. This mostly affects connections on LAN, as TCP is not used for connections over the internet by default.

TCP can have better performance on LAN networks and work on certain networks where UDP based protocols won't work.

However they can also suffer from "head of line" blocking, causing voices and poses to be significantly delayed.
messages.Settings.RealtimeNetworkingSettings.LNL_:
This controls the LNL protocol window size for real time networking. Changing this setting will have an immediate effect in all active sessions.

If you experience any packet queuing, you can increase this value to improve the connection throughput. However, higher values can also destabilize the connection further, so be careful.

<color=hero.yellow>Default Value:</color> 64

<color=hero.red>IMPORTANT:</color> This setting is for diagnostics and a temporary workaround; this value will automatically adjust itself in the future.
messages.Settings.AssetGatherSettings.MaxConcurre: Maximum number of concurrent asset transfers

When hosting sessions, this indicates how many locally imported assets can be transferred at the time. Increasing this can transfer assets to users faster, but can also degrade the quality of the network connection. We recommend testing what values can your network handle.
Use this to control how many assets can be downloaded at the same time. Using bigger value can speed up loading of worlds, but can also overload your network, so use caution when tweaking this value.
messages.Settings.HostAccessSettings.Entries.Allo: This indicates if HTTP(s) requests are allowed for this host. These are typically REST API requests to communicate with a third party services.
This indicates if realtime Websocket connections are allowed for this host. These are often used for more realtime bi-directional communications and data streams.
This indicates if {appName} can receive and process OSC data
This controls if {appName} is allowed to send data via OSC protocol to given host
messages.Settings.HostAccessSettings.Entries.Remo: Remove entry (you will be asked again next time)
messages.Settings.WindowsSettings.KeepOriginalScr: Enable this to avoid converting captured screenshots to JPG or PNG when saving them to the Documents folder in Windows. This can make them more difficult to use, as some apps might not be able to open the format.
messages.Settings.DebugSettings.DebugInputBinding: When enabled, you will see debugging information for the input binding system. This is mostly useful for developers.
messages.Settings.DebugSettings.ConvertParticleSy:
Enabling this option will run a conversion from the legacy particle system to the new custom one (PhotonDust) for any newly loaded items and worlds.

This is intended for testing purposes only! If you are not part of testing, we do not recommend turning this option on, YOUR CONTENT MIGHT BE CORRUPTED AS A RESULT.

Please see our GitHub/Discord if you'd like to help with testing.
messages.Settings.LegacyFeatureSettings.UseLegacy: Double press grip to equip items
When enabled, you can equip tools and gadgets by pressing grip twice in rapid succession. This setting will likely get removed at some point.
When enabled, the app button on your non-primary hand will open a legacy world switch to switch between active worlds. This feature will be replaced in the future by a more flexible solution.
When enabled, when you hold grip and press the App button (that normally opens/closes dash), it will open the legacy inventory or session menu.
messages.Settings.LegacyFeatureSettings.SuppressF:
This is to make certain features like posers that hijack feet proxies work, without having to modify them.

If you turn this on without using posers or similar features, the animations will NOT look correct. Turn this off after you're done using posers.

IMPORTANT: This will likely be removed at some point, we recommend upgrading posers to be compatible with the new system and automatically suppress the simulation when active.
messages.Settings.TwitchInterfaceSettings.Channel: This sets the default Twitch channel name for the Twitch Chat panel in the Camera Controls panel. This is mostly used by Twitch streamers who want to see their Twitch chat.
messages.Settings.MessagingPrivacySettings.DoNotS: Do not send realtime read status
When enabled, other users won't be able to see when you have read their messages immediately. You will also not see when they have read yours.
messages.Settings.LocaleSettings.CultureLocaleCod: When set, this will override the default culture locale used for formatting numbers and other quantities. Normally the culture of your selected locale will be used, but this lets you mix and match them. E.g. using your native language with US culture.
messages.Settings.LocaleSettings.UseImperialUnits: When enabled, editors for quantities (length/height, mass, volume...) will try to use imperial units instead of metric. Useful if you're from the US, UK, Liberia or Myanmar.
messages.Settings.DashSettings.DashCurvature.Desc: This controls how curved the dash is when you are in VR. Setting it to 0 will make it completely flat.
messages.Settings.DashSettings.OpenCloseSpeed.Des: Use this to adjust how quickly the dash opens and closes. If you don't like the animation, you can set this to very high value so dash opens and closes near instantly.
messages.Settings.DashSettings.AllowReplacingSett:
When enabled, you'll be able to pick the Settings facet on the dash when in UI edit mode and replace it with another.

This setting needs to be off if you want to pick the individual settings as facets. It's recommended to turn this on temporarily when you want to replace the settings UI with custom and then disable it again.
messages.Settings.NotificationSettings.UserOnline: This controls if you'll get notifications when your contacts come online.
messages.Settings.NotificationSettings.UserSociab:
When one of your contacts becomes sociable, you will receive a distinct notification with sound, so you can invite or poke them!

If you don't like these notifications, you can turn this off, which will treat Sociable status as no different from user coming Online for notifications.
messages.Settings.NotificationSettings.UserOnline: Contact Online on an incompatible build
This controls if you'll get notifications when your contacts come online when they are using a build that's not compatible with your own (e.g. a new version or pre-release builds).
messages.Settings.NotificationSettings.Message.De: This controls notifications you will get when you receive messages.
messages.Settings.NotificationSettings.Invite.Des: This controls if you get notifications when you are invited to a session.
messages.Settings.NotificationSettings.ContactReq: This controls what notifications you get when you receive a contact request from someone
messages.Settings.NotificationSettings.ContactSes: This controls what notifications you get when a new session is started by one of your contacts.
messages.Settings.NotificationSettings.PublicSess: This controls what notifications you get when a new public session is started by a person that's not your contact.
messages.Settings.NotificationSettings.UserJoinAn: When enabled, you will receive notifications when users join and leave the world you're currently in.
messages.Settings.NotificationSettings.Permission: When enabled, you will be notified when your permission role is changed in a world. E.g. when you are changed from Guest to Builder.
messages.Settings.NamePlateSettings.NameplateVisi: Use this to control whose nameplates will be visible to you.
messages.Settings.NamePlateSettings.UseCustomName: If some nameplates are difficult to read, completely hidden or you need to see user's actual username and badges (e.g. for moderation purposes), you disable custom nameplates and see the default ones.
messages.Settings.CustomizationSettings.UserInter:
When enabled, you'll be able to edit placements of Facets (modular pieces of UI) in the dash and on the facet anchors on your hands and viewport (if those are enabled).

Remember to turn this setting off once you are done! You can also turn it off using dedicated button under the dash.
messages.Settings.FacetAnchorsSettings.UseFacetAn: When enabled, you will be able to use the app button on your right controller to toggle facet anchors on your arms and forearms. These provide space to place any facets for quick access in addition to the main dash.
messages.Settings.FacetAnchorsSettings.AnimationS: This determines how quickly the facet anchors appear and hide when toggled.
messages.Settings.FacetAnchorsSettings.FacetAncho: This controls which controller (left or right) will toggle the facet anchors. The dash will be toggled with the other controller.
messages.Settings.FacetAnchorsSettings.ShowContai: Turning this off will disable the background visual on the facet anchors, making the facets themselves the only visible part.
messages.Settings.LaserSettings.SmoothSpeed.Descr: Use this to control how fast the laser responds to your movements. Lower values will make the laser more sluggish, but better at filtering tremors. Higher values will be more responsive, but also transfer more controller shake.
messages.Settings.LaserSettings.ModulateStartAngl: This indicates the angle at which the laser smoothing speed will start modulating to catch up to your movements. Increasing this value will require larger movements for the laser to start catching up.
Related to the modulate start angle, this indicates when the modulation will reach maximum speed. By changing the start and end angles, you can control how responsive the laser is the more you move your hand.
This controls the response curve of the laser modulation between the start and end angles. You can use this to either make the laser respond more sluggishly at first or to start responding quickly and then tapering off.
messages.Settings.LaserSettings.ModulateSpeedMult: The laser smoothing speed will be multiplied by this value once you have reached the modulate end angle. Increasing this value will make the laser catch up quicker once you move your hand far enough. Lowering the value will make it take longer to catch up.
messages.Settings.LaserSettings.StickThreshold.De: This controls how much the laser will stick to interactive items. Larger values will make it stick more. Setting this to zero will stop the stickiness completely.
messages.Settings.LaserSettings.ShowInDesktop.Des: When on, the laser visual will be rendered to you fully when in first person view in desktop mode.
messages.Settings.CursorSettings.BaseCursorSize.D: This sets a base cursor size. We recommend setting this first, before adjusting the others as their size is relative to this.
messages.Settings.CursorSettings.GrabMultiplier.D: This is applied as a multiplier to your cursor while grabbing objects and items.
messages.Settings.CursorSettings.InteractionMulti: This is applied as a multiplier to your cursor while interacting with UI elements such as buttons.
messages.Settings.CursorSettings.TextMultiplier.D: This is applied as a multiplier to your cursor while interacting and manipulating text.
messages.Settings.CursorSettings.SliderMultiplier: This is applied as a multiplier to your cursor while interacting with sliders and scrollbars.
messages.Settings.DesktopViewSettings.FollowCurso: When enabled, the Desktop view will automatically switch to whichever screen is your cursor on. This is useful when you're using physical keyboard and mouse while in VR.
The brightness of the desktop view.
messages.Settings.DesktopViewSettings.Opacity.Des: Lower the value to make the desktop view semi-transparent, making it easier to see what's behind it in the world.
messages.Settings.PhotoCaptureSettings.FingerGest: When enabled, you can quickly take pictures in world by posing your fingers to make a picture frame and then curling one of your index fingers.
messages.Settings.PhotoCaptureSettings.NormalCapt: This sets what resolution normal photos captured by the finger gesture or the desktop key shortcut will be. Higher resolutions will take more time and storage to process, but give better detail.
messages.Settings.PhotoCaptureSettings.TimerCaptu: Similar to normal resolution, you can set a separate resolution for photos captured with the timer feature. This can be useful if you use timer to capture group photos, which can benefit from higher resolution.
messages.Settings.PhotoCaptureSettings.TimerSecon: How many seconds does it take before a photo is captured with the timer feature.
messages.Settings.PhotoCaptureSettings.CaptureSte: When enabled, all quick photo captures will be stereoscopic. This is mostly useful when viewed in VR.
messages.Settings.PhotoCaptureSettings.StereoSepa:
Use this to control the separation between the stereo cameras when the stereo mode is on. This controls how distant the cameras are from each other, which affects the strength of the stereo effect for more distant objects.

When capturing close up objects, lower values will work better, when capturing large scenes, larger values will work better.
messages.Settings.PhotoCaptureSettings.PhotoAutos:
When set, any photos you capture (or save with context menu) will be automatically saved to your in-game inventory. For example <color=hero.yellow>Photos/%year%/%month_name%</color>

Following variables are available:

<size=75%>%second%, %minute%, %hour%, %day%, %month%, %year%, %day_name%, %day_name_en%, %month_name%, %month_name_en%, %session_second%, %session_minute%, %session_hour%, %session_day%, %session_month%, %session_year%, %session_day_name%, %session_day_name_en%, %session_month_name%, %session_month_name_en%, %location_name%, %app_version%</size>
messages.Settings.PhotoCaptureSettings.CapturePri:
When enabled, the quick photo capture will render your private UI such as the dash. This can be useful in case you want to show information there.

We recommend turning this setting off once you're done, as leaving it on can lead to accidentally capturing and leaking your private information.
messages.Settings.PhotoCaptureSettings.EncodeForm:
The image file format which captured photos will be encoded into. If you need the photos to be in particular format, you can use this setting to select which one they'll be encoded in.

Please note that certain formats might lack some features (like alpha support), might encode significantly slower, have lower image quality or result in bigger files.
messages.Settings.PhotoCaptureSettings.AlwaysHide: Turn this on if you want nameplates to never show in your photos. This setting is independent of the current nameplate visibility and will always ensure that they are hidden in captured photos.
messages.Settings.DesktopRenderSettings.FieldOfVi: Use this to control the field of view (FOV) when in desktop mode. Larger values will give you wider view at the cost of greater distortion on the sides.
messages.Settings.DesktopRenderSettings.SprintFie: When this option is enabled, your FOV will be zoomed when you are sprinting in Desktop. Disable this setting to remove this effect. Please note that this does NOT disable effects found in User Generated Content.
messages.Settings.DesktopRenderSettings.VSync.Des:
When this option is enabled, the framerate will be synced with the refresh rate of your screen. Disabling this can render frames faster, but it will also cause visible tearing.

This can be useful when doing performance testing as it will uncap the update and rendering speed.

<color=hero.red>IMPORTANT:</color> This setting cannot be toggled while in VR since framerate is controlled by VR.
messages.Settings.DesktopRenderSettings.LimitFram: When enabled, the framerate will be limited to a set value when the application window is unfocused. This is useful if you use other programs and games at the same time, as it will free up more resources for them.
messages.Settings.DesktopRenderSettings.MaximumBa: This determines the allowed maximum framerate while in background. Lower values will conserve more system resources.
messages.Settings.InteractiveCameraFramingSetting: This controls how the interactive camera is positioned in the world.
The field of view of the interactive camera. Higher values will capture more of the scene at the cost of distortion at the edges.
In third person or group mode, this controls position around circle of the target subject/group.
In third person or group mode, this controls how far away the camera is from the target subject/group.
In third person or group mode, this lets you move the camera higher or lower relative to the target subject/group.
In first person mode, use this to pitch the camera up and down.
In first person mode, this controls the sideways rotation of the camera - tilting of left and right
Use this to move the camera offset in first person view relative to your eyes. This can be used if the avatar face geometry is clipping into the camera's view.
These are normalized coordinates in the camera's viewport. The camera will try to frame the target (e.g. user's head in third person mode) to this position in the viewport.

Instead of camera pointing directly at the user's head, it will try to aim at a point in front of user's head. This can be useful when you want to frame what the user is looking at (e.g. in-world items and interfaces).
messages.Settings.InteractiveCameraPositioningSet: If the view of the camera would be obscured by collidable object, it will automatically move closer to avoid the occlusion.

Make sure that the camera stay in the root world space, rather than parenting itself in the same space as the user. This can give better framing and positioning when using user anchors (e.g. in vehicles).
This adds a random movement offset to the position of the camera that changes over time. This can make shots look less static, especially if you don't move much.
messages.Settings.InteractiveCameraRenderSettings: The camera will not render any user badges, regardless of your badge setting.
The camera will not render any user interaction lasers.
User eyes always look at camera
When avatar uses simulated eye movement (meaning the user doesn't have eye tracking), this will make avatar prioritize eye contact with the camera.
Users that are within this distance will be added to the group that the camera is automatically framing in the group mode.
How far does the user need to move away from the group radius before they are excluded from the group.
messages.Settings.InteractiveCameraSmoothingSetti: This indicates how fast does the camera move to its target position in the world. Larger values will make the camera move faster, but also result in more jerky movements.
This indicates how quickly does the camera respond to change in angle around the target subject.
This controls how fast the camera adjusts its framing of the target subject. Larger values will make it track the target faster, but also result in more jerky movements.
messages.Settings.InteractiveCameraAnchorSettings: When enabled, camera will smoothly interpolate between camera anchors in the world.
When interpolation between anchors is enabled, this controls how fast the camera moves from one anchor to another.

Enable this to use linear interpolation when moving between anchors instead of a smooth one. Linear interpolation starts and stops abruptly, but has a constant movement speed, regardless of the distance between anchors. This means that if anchors are further apart, it'll take longer for the camera to reach it.
When you take photos using the interactive camera dialog, should they be spawned into the world? When disabled, they will only be saved to your documents or inventory (if autosave is configured)
messages.Settings.InteractiveCameraPostProcessing: Should the camera render motion blur effect?
Should the camera render screen space reflections effects? This can provide better reflections for shiny surfaces, but can lead to artifacts and increased performance requirements.
messages.Settings.DescriptionField.NoTextDescript: <i><alpha=#77>Hover over a setting to see its description.</closeall>
messages.Settings.RelaySettings.AlwaysUseRelay.De: Relays are typically used as a fallback when a direct connection to the host cannot be established. By enabling this option, you will force the connection to always happen through a relay. This can be useful in cases of connection issues to particular hosts. It is NOT recommended to have this option permanently on.
messages.Settings.RelaySettings.UseClosestAvailab: When this option is enabled the closest available relay will be automatically selected. If you want to connect through a specific relay (e.g. in case of long distance connections to avoid packet queuing) you can disable this option and configure the preferred relays below.
messages.Settings.PostProcessingSettings.MotionBl:
This controls the strength of the motion blur effect, which smears image with motion. Higher values will result in more blurring with same amount of motion.

If you set the effect to <nobr><color=hero.yellow>0 %</color></nobr> the filter will be disabled completely, which can improve performance.
messages.Settings.PostProcessingSettings.BloomInt:
Bloom effect causes a glow to appear around bright objects in the scene, typically with ones in the HDR range. This lets you control the strength of this effect for the same amount of light. 

Please note that some content can look incorrect when this effect is set to low or disabled.

If you set the effect to <nobr><color=hero.yellow>0 %</color></nobr> the filter will be disabled completely, which can improve performance.
messages.Settings.PostProcessingSettings.AmbientO:
Ambient Occlusion darkens creases and corners in the scene, which would typically receive less light. This can give the scene more depth and realism. Using this control you can control the intensity of the effect.

Please note that by setting this too low or disabling it, some content might look incorrect or completely flat when it otherwise would not.

If you set the effect to <nobr><color=hero.yellow>0 %</color></nobr> the filter will be disabled completely, which can improve performance.
messages.Settings.PostProcessingSettings.ScreenSp:
When enabled, any parts of the scene currently visible to the camera will reflect off shiny surfaces in realtime. This can add more realism to the scene and improve look of shiny surfaces at cost of extra performance.

Please note that this filter is considered experimental right now and does not work well in a lot of scenarios, resulting in ghostly reflections and artifacts.
messages.Settings.PostProcessingSettings.Antialia:
Antialising smooths out sharp jagged edges on objects in the scene. You can select from several different filters, with each filter having different downsides. FXAA is commonly used and works reasonably well enough, but can also blur other parts of the scene, such as text.

<color=red>Warning:</color> Some AA options might not be suitable or work at all in VR.
messages.Settings.TextureQualitySettings.TextureS:
This determines the relative size of all textures that will be loaded. You can use this to lower the overall resolution of textures, which improves VRAM usage and loading speed at the cost of visual clarity.

For example if the texture is 4K and you set this to half resolution, 2K version of the texture will be loaded instead.

Use this to limit the maximum resolution of loaded textures. Any textures above this resolution will be limited to the set resolution. Any textures that are smaller than this will not be affected.

This setting is applied after the relative texture size.
messages.Settings.TextureQualitySettings.MinimumT:
This controls the minimum resolution of the texture that will be limited by the settings above. If the texture is below this size, it will be loaded as is.

E.g. if you set this to 512, then if texture is 256, it will be still loaded as 256 even if the texture size ratio is set to half.
messages.Settings.TextureQualitySettings.DefaultF:
This controls the filtering used for textures, which controls their quality and performance.

<color=hero.yellow>Point:</color> Lowest quality with no interpolation. Textures will be blocky.

<color=hero.yellow>Bilinear:</color> Texture pixels are interpolated, but mip map transitions will be harsh, leading to a visible transition line.

<color=hero.yellow>Trilinear:</color> Smoothly transitions between different mip levels, removing the harsh transition line at distance.

<color=hero.yellow>Anisotropic:</color> Highest quality, textures will be sharp even at steep angles.
messages.Settings.TextureQualitySettings.Anisotro: Controls the quality of the anisotropic filtering.
messages.Settings.ResolutionSettings.Fullscreen.D: Toggles between fullscreen mode and windowed mode
messages.Settings.ResolutionSettings.WindowResolu: What resolution should be used when in the windowed mode. This controls the actual size of the window on the screen.
messages.Settings.ResolutionSettings.FullscreenRe: What resolution should be used when in fullscreen mode. The size will remain the same, but lowering the resolution can improve performance (particularly with high-resolution screens like 4K) at the cost of more blurry image.
messages.Settings.RenderingQualitySettings.PerPix:
This controls how many point & spot lights can directly affect objects rendered using the forward method - typically transparent and non-PBS objects (e.g. with the toon shader).

Increasing this value will improve the quality of lighting and reduce color flickering in presence of multiple lights at the cost of performance - the object needs to be rendered multiple times for each light affecting it.
messages.Settings.RenderingQualitySettings.Shadow: This controls the resolution cascading of the shadows for directional lights in the world. Cascades better distribute the resolution of the shadow map - providing higher shadow resolution up close and lower resolution further away, but cost more performance to render.

This controls the resolution of shadows for lights. Increasing this value will give shadow smoother edges and better definition, but increase the performance requirements.

Please note that some lights might override the shadow resolution and won't be affected by this setting.

This controls the distance that shadows cover. Increasing this value will make sure more distant parts of the scene are properly covered in shadows, but this also spreads out the detail of the shadow over larger area.

You should change this setting together with the shadow cascades and resolution - with higher shadow resolution, you can afford higher shadow distance. If you lower the shadow resolution and cascades, you'll want to lower the shadow distance so shadows have better definition.
messages.Settings.RenderingQualitySettings.SkinWe:
For any skinned meshes (3D models that are deformed by bones, like most avatars), this controls how many bones are used to affect position of each vertex.

Lowering this value will save some performance, but the deformation quality will be lower, resulting in sharp creases and other artifacts, typically around joints.

messages.Inspector.CharacterController.Warning:
AVERTO!
Eblas uzi ĉi tiun komponanton kiel simple rigidkorpo per elekti by checking SimuliRotacion. Antaŭ ol vi faros, bonvolu kompreni ke tio ne estas optimumigita por ĉi tiu celo kaj ĝusta subteno por Rigidkorpoj venos ose.
Ĝusta subteno por rigidkorpoj ofertos:
- rendimento de CPU kaj reto - per RolulKontrolilo vi akiros pli trean usado de la CPU kaj gravan kvanton de rettrafikon
- Limigoj - vi eblos krei artikojn, ĉarnirojn, risortojn, kaj aliaj limigojn inter rigidkorpojn
- Glata simulado kaj interago por ĉiuj - Rolulkontrolilo missignalos se alia persono provos interagi
- Novaj Ebloj kaj Iloj - por fari la uzo de ilin multe pli faciler
-----------------------
Tiel longe kiel vi komprenas tiujn limigojn, amuziĝu!
messages.Inspector.PrimitiveMemberEditor.Warning:

messages.Tutorial.Welcome.Description:
Plonĝu en tute novan bituniverson kun nefinitaj eblecoj. Ĉu vi venas ĉi tien por societumi kaj kunvivi kun homoj tra la mondo aŭ konstrui, krei, kaj evoluigi iun ajn de bela desegnarto, interageblaj avataroj kaj akcesoraĵo, al kompleksaj interageblajmondoj kaj ludoj, Resonite estas nefina tajlorebla loko kie vi estos bonvenita kaj trovos grupon kun kiun resoni.

Antaŭ ol vi komencos esplori, ni unue givdos vin tra la agordo de iuj ajn necesaĵojn, por certigi glatan sperton. Kiam vi pretas, alklaku la butonon suban
messages.Tutorial.Welcome.AccountDescription: Krei konton donas al vi 1GB senpagan stokadon kaj aliron al konservado de artikoloj, plej ŝatatajn avataroj, aldono de kontaktuloj kaj mesaĝoj.
messages.Tutorial.Welcome.AccountSkipDescription: Iuj funkcioj kiel konservi artikolojn por stokado, plej ŝatatan avataron pri aldono de kontakultoj ne estos alireblaj.
messages.Tutorial.Welcome.SettingsDescription: Vi povas agordi bazajn movajn kaj uzulajn preferojn. Ĉiuj ĉi povas esti ŝanĝitaj poste.
messages.Tutorial.Welcome.SettingsSnapTurn.Descri: Tuj ŝanĝas al nova angulo. Ideala por novaj uzantoj
messages.Tutorial.Welcome.SettingsSmoothTurn.Desc: Iom post iom turniĝas, sed povas kaŭzi naŭzon.

messages.Tutorial.Welcome.StartTutorialDescriptio: Ni translokos vin al baza lernila mondo por helpi vin komenci kun {appName}. Vi povas elekti aŭ havi la lernil-mondon publika, permesante al {appName}-komunumo aliĝi kaj helpi vin, aŭ lerni memstare.
messages.Tutorial.CommunityYouTube.Title: Komunumaj YouTube-kanaloj
messages.Tutorial.Intro.BadgesDescription: Insignoj estas malgrandaj simboloj kiuj montras trajtojn de uzanto. Tie ĉi troviĝas kelkete da gravaj memorindaj insignoj. La handikap-insignoj povas esti aŭtomate asignitaj per la {appName}-roboto

messages.Migration.Title: Migrado
messages.Migration.LoginModal.Title: Migrigi datumojn?
messages.Migration.LoginModal.Description: Ĉu al vi plaĉus migrigi datumojn de alia konto? Vi ankaŭ povas elekti fari ĉi tion pli poste uzante la langeton "Migrado" en la Panelo.
messages.Migration.LoginResetID.Title: Ĉu vere restartigi la Uzantnumeron?
messages.Migration.LoginResetID.Description: Bonvolu kompreni ke ĉi tia ago rezultos en <color=red>LA NEANTAŬVIDEBLA ROMPIĜO DE ENHAVOJ</color>. Ĉiuj viaj aĵoj, mondoj, kontaktuloj, kaj mesaĝoj estos sukcese migradigotaj, sed iuj kondutoj kaj komponantoj kiuj fidi al la referenco de via malnova Uzantnumero varŝajne rompiĝos kaj bezonos esti re-agordotaj kaj reparotaj. Krome se vi havas seriozan reason por voli restartigi vian Uzantnumeron, <color=red>NE ELEKTU ĈI TIUN OPCION</color>.
messages.Migration.ReservedUsername.Title: Rezervita Uzantnomo
messages.Migration.ReservedUsername.Description: Ĉi tiu uzantnomo estas rezervita por ĝia originala posedanto. Se ĉi tio estas via konto, bonvolu provizi viajn identigilojn de {platform} por malŝlosi ĝin. Ni ne konservos ĉi tiujn itentigilojn, iliaj estas nur uzotaj por kontroli la posedecon de via konto dum registriĝo.
messages.Migration.Dialog.Title: Konto-Migrado
messages.Migration.Dialog.Source: You can migrate data from any compatible infrastructure. First select one from the list below that you'd like to migrate data from. You can add additional infrastructures by placing config files in the "Migrations" folder in the installation.
messages.Migration.Dialog.AccountDescription: To migrate your account, we'll need your {platform} account password. This will let us login to it and access the data.
messages.Migration.ResetID.Title: Restartigi mian Uzantnomeron
messages.Migration.ResetID.Description: AVERTO: Elekti ĉi tiun opcion PARTE ROMPOS EKZISANTAJN ENHAVOJN KAJ ES NENULIGEBLA, ĉi tiu enhavas iu ajn Uzantnom-referencoj en enhavoj de uzantoj, servicoj de la komunumo, ligiloj, nubovariabloj, kaj pli. Ĉi tiuj referencoj estos restartigotaj, sed via aĵoj, mondoj, kontaktuloj, kaj mesaĵoj mem ne perdotos. Ni rekomendas ke vi uzu ĉi tiun opcion NUR se al vi plaĉus forĵeti vian malnovan Uzantnumeron kaj anstataŭi ĝin per nova, hazargidita Uzantnumero. Krom se vi havas fortan motivan restartigi vian Uzantnumeron, vi NE ELEKTU ĉi tiun opcion. Via Uzantnumero ŝanĝos ĉi tiel: U-MiaUzantnomo -> U-fX3pKe7AYYQ
messages.Migration.DataSelection.Title: Kiam ni migradigos vian kondon, kiujn datumojn ni migradigu?
messages.Migration.DataSelection.Favorites: Plej Ŝatatajoj (avataro, hejmo, fotilo, kalvaro, faceotj)
messages.Migration.DataSelection.Favorites.Descri: Ĉi tiu migradigos vian hejmon, plej ŝatatajn avataron, klavaron, kaj panelon unue, por ke vi povas uzi ilin kiom baldaŭ tiom eble. AVERTO: Se vi elektu ĉi tiun opcion, eble vi PERDOS IUJN AJN ŜANĜOJN faritajn en ĉi tiu platformo antaŭ ol la migrado al viajn plej ŝatataĵon.
messages.Migration.DataSelection.Favorites.Overwr: Dum la migrado, ni anstataŭigu viajn plej ŝatataĵojn?
messages.Migration.DataSelection.Home.Title: Agordi vian malnovan hejmon kiel defaŭlto?
messages.Migration.DataSelection.Home.Description: When we migrate your data, your original cloud home will be placed under different URL and you will get a brand new cloud home as default. However if you'd prefer, we can default your old home as the default one. Even if you select "No", your old cloud home will still be accessible and you can favorite it as your default later.
messages.Migration.Groups.Title: Migradigi Grupojn
messages.Migration.Groups.Description: Ĉiaj grupo, de kiuj vi estas administranto, migradotos defaŭlte. Se vi volus migradigi nur elektitajn grupojn, alklaku la butonon sube por ŝargi ilin kaj poste, elekti tiujn grupojn, kiujn vi volus migradigi.
messages.Migration.Groups.NoGroups: Neniuj grupoj en {platform} trovitaj por migradigi.
messages.Migration.Groups.NotGroupAdmin: Vi ne stas administranto de iuj ajn grupoj de {platform}, demandoj la administrantojn de viaj grupoj por migradigi la grupojn!
messages.Migration.Summary:
Bone, ni havas ĉiujn, kiujn ni bezonas. Alklaku Komenci Migradon sube kaj ni ekkomecos je via migrado.

La migrado eble daŭros iatempe ĉar ni devas transkopii ĉiujn. Se vi elektis migradigi viajn plej preferataĵon, ni prioritaigi ilin por ke vi povos vin farigi komforta.

Ne necesas ke vi daŭrigu {appName} rulantan ĉiam ni migradigas, sed ni sendos al vi ĝisdatigojn per la roboto de {appName} por sciigi vin kiel la migrado fartas.
messages.Migration.List.EmptySubtitle: Alklaku  "Nova Migrad-Taskon" en la supre maldekstro.
messages.Migration.Report.Title: Raporto de Migrad-Taskojn:
messages.Migration.Report.EstimatedQueuePosition: <color={hex}>Restantaj taskoj en vico antaŭ ol ĉi tiu:</color> {value}
messages.Migration.ColorManagement:
Ĉi tiu mondo aŭtoriĝis en gama spaco kaj aŭtomate estis konvertita al la linea.

Ĝi eble aspektos malsame ol la originala, sed estu ĝenerale uzebla.

Se vi estas la aŭtoro kaj trovas iujn problemojn en la konverto de la mondo, NE KONSERVU. Nur konservu kopiojn.

Kiom longe tiom ekzistas la orginalo, ni povos optimumigi la procezon de konverto. Alie vi respondecos pri ĝi mem ripari.

messages.Tutorial.Saving.Title: Bonvenon Hejmen!
messages.Tutorial.Saving.Content:
Bonvenon al via Hejm-mondo! Ĉi tie estas tie, kie vi aperiĝos ĉiufoje kiam vi ensalutos.

Ĉi tio estas mundo tuta propra, do iujn ŝanĝojn vi faras estas konserveblan.

Se vi konservos, ĉio estos precize kial forlasita kiam vi revenos!
messages.Tutorial.Teleporter.Error:
Malsukcesis ŝarĝi vian nubohejmon!
Eliru el la teleportilo kaj eniru denove por reprovi.
messages.CloudHome.Info.DashInfoTab.Title: Bonvenon!
messages.CloudHome.Info.DashInfoDesktop:
Por viaj unuaj paŝoj, estas kelkaj aferoj pri kiuj vin ni sciigu. Vi havas Panelon, kiun vi povas malfermi per premi la eskapan klavon. Bonvolu pensi pri ĝi kiel via labortablo aŭ kontrolpanelo.

Ĉu vi konfusiĝis, ĉi tiu ekrano havas ian kroman informon por vin helpi. Alklaku la suban butonon por kaŝi ĉi tiun mesaĝon.

Ĉu vi konfusiĝis, ĉi tiu ekrano havas ian kroman informon por vin helpi. Alklaku la suban butonon por kaŝi ĉi tiun mesaĝon.

Ĉu vi konfusiĝis, ĉi tiu ekrano havas ian kroman informon por vin helpi. Alklaku la suban butonon por kaŝi ĉi tiun mesaĝon.
messages.CloudHome.Info.ModerationTab.Title: Kontrolado!
messages.CloudHome.Info.ModerationTab.Content:
Sekureco tre gravas al ni. Se vi bezonas helpon aŭ bezonas raporti pri uzanto, malfermu help-bileton en nia Portalo de Kontrolado.

Ni havas fortan temamon de volontaj kontralodisto kiuj konservas la komunumon sekura! Bonvolu krei help-bileton se vi havas demandojn aŭ observas konduton, kio rompas la gvidnormaron.
messages.CloudHome.Info.InventoryTab.Title: Konservi Viajn Erojn!
messages.CloudHome.Info.InventoryTab.Content:
La Inventaro en via Panelo enhavas viajn konserviajn avatarojn kaj erojn.

La dosierujo Esencaĵoj enhavas iajn amuzajn erojn kun kiuj vi povas ludi; duoble alklaki eron por generi ĝin!
messages.CloudHome.Info.ToolsTab.Title: En-Monda Redaktado!
messages.CloudHome.Info.ToolsTab.Content:
Prima trajto de {appName} estas ke la ebleco facile kreii aŭ modifi aĵon direkte en-lude.

Jes, tio signifas ĝuste ĉi tie! Aŭ ie ajn, vere - la iloj haveblaj en Esencaĵoj -> Iloj en via inventaro permesas al vi facile redakti la mondon ĉirkaŭ vi al via prefero.
messages.CloudHome.Info.HelpTab.Title: Akiri Helpon
messages.CloudHome.Info.HelpTab.InfoLineOne: Ĉu via bezonas helpon? Esplori nian <u><color=hero.cyan>Wiki-paĝaron</color></u><sprite name=hyperlink>, aŭ akiri respondojn por viaj
messages.CloudHome.Info.HelpTab.InfoLineTwo: demandoj en nia Discord-servilo! Facile, vi povas vidi ligilojn sur via labortablo per via Panelo en la langeto Labortablo.
messages.CloudHome.Info.UsersTab.Title: Trovi Uzantojn
messages.CloudHome.Info.UsersTab.Content:
Publikaj seancoj estas bonega metodo mem mergiĝi en la komunumon!

Publikaj seancoj, kiujn vi povas nun ekaliĝi estas troveblaj en la langeto Mondoj en via panalo. Bonvolu esplori!
messages.StickyNote.RelevantLinks:

messages.StickyNote.TheaterTablet: Uzi ĉi tiun tabuleton por kontroli la ventumilon kaj nuancon de la fenestroj en ĉi tiu ĉambro!
messages.StickyNote.ControlTablet: Uzi ĉi tiun tabuleton por kontroli partoj de la hejmo!
messages.StickyNote.EquipMeDesktop: Ekipi per mi kaj premi la maldekstran musbutonon!
messages.StickyNote.EquipMeVR: Ekipi per mi kaj tiri la ŝnuron!
messages.StickyNote.DipBrushes: Trempi penikojn en globojn por uzi materialojn
messages.StickyNote.BrushColor: Ŝanĝi la penik-koloron kaj grandecon en via Kuntekst-Menuo
messages.StickyNote.Drawing: Vi povas desegni sur ĉi tiu tabulo, en la aero, aŭ ie ajn!

messages.CloudHome.AvatarPanel.Title: Rekomenditaj Avatar-Mondoj
messages.CloudHome.SupporterPanel.Title: Niaj Subtenantoj
messages.Tutorial.InfoPanel.Title: Hej! Antaŭ ol vi foriros...
messages.Tutorial.InfoPanel.Content:
Mondo de eblecoj atendas vin, kaj tio, kio eblas limiĝas nur je via imago.

Preskaŭ ĉiuj la eroj, kiujn vi vidis ĝis nun estis faritaj ĝuste en-lude! Homoj el la tuta mondo laboris kune realtempe por konstrui ĉi tion.

La platformo ja tre estas en frua programado kaj ni estas konstante ĝisdatigi kaj plibonigi aferojn. Sed vi ankaŭ estas parto de ĉi tiu vojaĝo, and la ĉielo estas la limo!

Dankon pro via vizito.
messages.Tutorial.Panel.Jumping.Title: Salti
messages.Tutorial.Panel.Jumping.ContentDesktop: Kiam movi per Marŝi, premu la spacostangon por salti!
messages.Tutorial.Panel.Jumping.ContentVR: Kiam movi per Marŝi, subpremu la stirstangon por salti!
messages.Tutorial.Panel.Jumping.ContentVRNoButton: Kiam movi per Marŝi, subpremu la centron de la tuŝplaton por salti!
messages.Tutorial.Panel.WalkLocomotion.Title: Movi per Marŝi
messages.Tutorial.Panel.WalkLocomotion.Content: Movu kaj saltu trans la grundo.
messages.Tutorial.Panel.TeleportLocomotion.Title: Movi per Teleporti
messages.Tutorial.Panel.TeleportLocomotion.Conten: Telepori tuj sendos vin al la indikilo de teleportado.
messages.Hints.Spawn.ContextMenuDesktop: Malfermu la Kunteksmenuon per premi T por opcioj!
messages.Hints.Spawn.ContextMenuVR: Ĉu vi sentas vin malsana? Feeling sick? Malfermu la Kunteksmenuon per premi B aŭ Y por opcioj!
messages.Hints.Spawn.ContextMenuVRNoButtons: Ĉu vi sentas vin malsana? Malfermu la Kunteksmenuon per premi la Menu-butonon por opcioj!
messages.Hints.Spawn.TeleportLocomotionDesktop: Aliaj opcioj por movado, kiel flugi, estas haveblaj por provo en la Movad-menuo.
messages.Hints.Spawn.TeleportLocomotionVR: Aliaj opcioj por movado, kiel flugi aŭ teleporti, or fly, estas haveblaj por provo en la Movad-menuo.
messages.Hints.Bridge.RaiseTheWorld: Alklaku ĉi tiun butonon por movi la platformon al vi!
messages.Hints.Grabbing.GrabbingDesktop: Fizike ekpreni erojn per premteni la dekstran musbutonon!
messages.Hints.Grabbing.GrabbingVR: Fizike ekpreni erojn per premteni la Kroĉilon!
messages.Hints.Grabbing.Rotating: Turnigu erojn, kiujn vi tenas, per premtemi E kaj movi la muson!
messages.Hints.Grabbing.RotatingExtra: Premtemu E kaj la majuskligan klavon samtempe por turnigi eron ĉirkaŭ ĝia horizontala akso!
messages.Hints.Grabbing.ScalingDesktop: Ekprenu eron, premtemu la majuskligan klavon, kaj uzu la rumilon de la muso por skali ĝin!
messages.Hints.Grabbing.ScalingVR: Fizike ekprenu erojn per ambaŭ manoj por skali ilin!
messages.Hints.Grabbing.OtherGrabbables: Estas diversaj interagadeblaĵoj, ludu kun ĉi tiuj tri por elkovri, kiel ili funkcias!
messages.Hints.Grabbing.OtherGrabbablesExtraDeskt: Aldone al skali objektojn, vi povas ankaŭ skali vi mem per ebligi skali en via Kuntekstmenuo, kaj poste premteni la stirklavon kaj uzi la rumilon de la muso!
messages.Hints.Grabbing.OtherGrabbablesExtraVR: Aldone al skali objektojn, vi povas ankaŭ skali vi mem per ebligi skali en via Kuntekstmenuo, ekpreni antaŭ ol vi mem per ambaŭ manoj, kaj movi la manojn pli kaj pli malproksime!
messages.Hints.Telescope.Alignment: Ekprenu la teleskopon kaj celi ĝin je la luno!
messages.Hints.Telescope.TheMoonDesktop: Kiam celianta je la luno, premtenu la dekstran muskbutonon kaj ĉirkaŭrigardu por movigi la lunon!
messages.Hints.Telescope.TheMoonVR: Utiligi vian laseron per la ellasila butono kaj ekprenu la lunon!
messages.Hints.Sundial.SoftEquip: Ekprenu ĉi tion utilon por uzi ĝin!
messages.Hints.Sundial.SoftEquipExtra: Utilon permesas al vi ŝanĝi la ĉirkaŭan mondon per diversaj metodoj!
messages.Hints.Sundial.HardEquip: Alklaku ĉi tion utilon por ekipi per ĝi!
messages.Hints.Sundial.HardEquipExtra: Ĉu vi ne vidas vian lasaron?  Malpeze premtemula ellasilan butonon por malkaŝi gin!!
messages.Hints.Sundial.TheSun: Celu je la ĉielon por movi la sunon tien!
messages.Hints.Sundial.TheSunExtra: Provu celi suben de la horizonto por noktigi la mondon!
messages.Hints.Sundial.Dequip: Falugu la nunan utilon per elekti Malekipi en la Kuntekstmenuo.
messages.Hints.Sundial.DequipExtra: Rigardu ke la opcioj en via Kuntekstmenuo ŝanĝigis ĉar vi tenas ĉi tian utilon.
messages.Hints.Sundial.Teleporter: Alklaku ĉi tiun butonon por aktivigi la Teleportilon al via Nubohejmo!
messages.Hints.Sundial.TeleporterExtra: Ĝuu vian novan hejmon kaj dankon pro via vizito!
